has issued an investigation conclusion recommending the
prosecution of 86 defendants in the case related
to the Joint Stock Company.  Van Thinh
Phat Group, SCB bank and related units, the
investigation agency determined that the defendant
Truong My Lan, chairman of Van Thinh Phat,
caused a total loss of more than 415,000 billion
VND. C Truong My Lan was asked to be prosecuted.
Charged with three counts of bribery, violating regulations on
bank operations and embezzlement of
assets according to investigation conclusions. Truong My Lan, the
main shareholder in SCB bank, was accused
of using SCB as a channel to mobilize capital for
individuals.  Together with his accomplices, he falsified capital mobilization documents
to withdraw money from SCB. Truong My l appropriated
304.2 6 billion VND from SCB, this amount of money to
date, the bank cannot pay and
generated interest of more than 129,000 billion VND.
Truong  My Lan has claimed a total loss of
more than 45,000 billion VND in the case of fraudster Do
Thi Nhan, former director of the
State Bank's Bank Inspection Department, has been
proposed to be prosecuted for bribery.
2 million USD to cover up the
violations of Truong My Lan and
SCB Bank. In addition to the three crimes proposed for
prosecution, Truong My Lan was also prosecuted for
fraudulent appropriation of property through
the issuance of bonds.  The amount of
fraud amounted to more than 30,000 billion VND from
investors. Da Nang city police arrested
Nguyen Thai, 39 years old, and Dao Nguyen
Nghi, 41, both residing in Da Nang city
to investigate fraud.
Appropriating assets, these two subjects gave
dishonest information to
mobilize capital to appropriate nearly 40 billion VND from
hundreds of
people. According to the investigation, the newly established joint stock company
registered
charter capital 8  billion VND. By November 6,
2020, this company changed its
business registration content and increased its charter capital
to 200 billion VND. However, the
founding shareholders did not contribute actual capital to the company
and had no assets. Dien Van  I think it's
not that the shareholders do not own shares,
but they have taken advantage of the company's legal status
to provide false information,
soliciting investors to contribute money
to buy shares, promising that the shares will increase in
value.  In addition, the two subjects also set up an
illegal website and app so that investors could
trust that the shares purchased could be

others to participate from  Meanwhile, Dien and
